subject: p17704774
History: -year-old woman with chest tube placed to waterseal. Evaluate for pneumothoraces.
Findings: Comparison is made to the prior study from. There are diffuse nodular opacities throughout both lung fields consistent with patients known widespread metastatic disease. There is again seen a small right apical pneumothorax. The right-sided chest tube has been pulled back slightly. The pneumothorax at the right base now appears filled with fluid and is compatible with a hydropneumothorax as seen on the prior CT scan from. There is increased density at the left base as well which is stable. The hardware in the lower lumbar spine is stable. There is a right IJ catheter with the distal lead tip in the distal SVC, stable.
